name: Santos Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great wewlcome from the staff really friendly and helpful but whilst showing us to our room the veil began to drop. No gym (OK maybe we should have checked more) but worse still no bar and not one even within walking distance around the hotel.
reviews.title: 5-star staff, 3-star hotel

reviews.text: OK moving on to when we got in after dinner, as there was no bar, went to the mini bar (fridge) in the room and had a Mother Hubbard experience in finding that the cupboard was bare. Phoning the front desk at first I was told to go to the nearest convenience store but eventually they brought me up a couple of cans for solace.
reviews.title: Clean rooms. Good service, attentive staff. Walking distance to MRT Minquan rd. station and NET store beside it.

reviews.text: Now the issue with the fridge doesn't end there as even though it was empty it was still turned on and it is obviously not very efficient as it keeps turning itself on and off all night disrupting sleep which would otherwise be OK in a fairly quiet part of town and on a highish floor. Anyway the fridge wasn't the only criminal in sleep prevention as the paper thin walls meant you could listen to everyone elses conversations and movements in the adjacent rooms. And don't get me on to the state of the mattress......
reviews.title: Another room with a magnificent view

reviews.text: Morning calls and going for a shower.....if one is greater than 1.85m tall then you cannot stand in the bath for a shower without your head hitting the ceiling - not the best way to wash your hair and body crouching down. If I get a bad back I'll sue.
reviews.title: Worked for me

reviews.text: Frankly the rooms are tired and are in dire need of an overhaul, whilst at all stages the staff were perfectly accomodating this place wasn't worth the money. I've stayed in better B & B,s (but without the staff attention).
reviews.title: Very happy with this Taipei hotel, will stay again

description: Located in the heart of Taipei City on Chengde Road, Santos Hotel has been dedicated to providing not only exceptional quality services to travelers with warm hospitality, but also personalized touches in making every guests' stay a memorable experience since 1979. This 4-star rated 287-room hotel is the perfect accommodation choice for the first time as well as returning visitors to this cosmopolitan city. Within 3-minute walking distance to the nearest Minquan West Road MRT station, Santos Hotel is also close to popular and must-see points-of-interest including Shilin Night Market, National Palace Museum, Beitou hot spring, Confucius Temple, and Taipei Expo Park. Our service staffs, proficient in English and Japanese, will ensure your needs are met to your satisfaction. Free high speed wireless Internet access is available both in room and throughout the hotel. For added luxury, flat panel LCD TV with satellite channels including HBO and CNN, and in-room safe are standard in every room.
